recommendations.title: Focus Mode - Distraction-Free Workspace
recommendations.description: Add a zen-like focus mode that minimizes the UI to just the current task. Essential for TJ who works in cafes/libraries and needs to stay focused.
recommendations.rationale: TJ's USER.md notes he works in third places (cafes mornings, libraries afternoons) and his mind wanders to loneliness/immigration stress. A focus mode helps maintain flow state.

code_changes: Add 'Focus' toggle button in header-right area
Create CSS class `.focus-mode` that hides nav-tabs, metrics, secondary panels
Only show: current active task/card + minimal controls
Blur background slightly to reduce visual noise
implementation.new_css: `.focus-mode .header { opacity: 0.1; transition: opacity 0.3s; } .focus-mode .header:hover { opacity: 1; } .focus-mode .nav-tabs, .focus-mode .metrics-grid { display: none; } .focus-mode .main-content { max-width: 800px; margin: 0 auto; padding-top: 4rem; }`

recommendations.impact: High - Directly addresses user's core pain point

recommendations.title: Daily Cosmic Quote Widget
recommendations.description: Add a rotating quote from Vonnegut, Sagan, or the Paintress universe that appears in the dashboard header. Rotates daily at midnight.
recommendations.rationale: TJ has logged the Vonnegut Protocol ('So it goes. Create anyway.') and Sagan Frequency ('Preserve the wonder. Stay cosmic.') as core invariants. This reinforces his philosophical anchors daily.

recommendations.title: Keyboard Shortcuts Modal & Help
recommendations.description: Add a comprehensive keyboard shortcuts guide accessible via '?' key or help button. Shows all available shortcuts in a modal.
recommendations.rationale: TJ is a power user and night owl who values efficiency. Quick keyboard navigation supports his workflow without breaking focus.

recommendations.title: Starry Background Animation Enhancement
recommendations.description: Enhance the existing starfield with subtle parallax effect on mouse movement and occasional shooting stars for visual delight.
recommendations.rationale: The cosmic theme is central to Pleiades identity. Small delight animations create a sense of living in the interface.

techniques: Transform stars layer slightly opposite to mouse movement
Keep performance in mind - use transform and opacity only

recommendations.title: Smart Notification Toast System
recommendations.description: Upgrade the basic toast to support: multiple stacked toasts, different types (info, success, warning, error), auto-dismiss with progress bar, and action buttons.
recommendations.rationale: Current toast is basic. Better feedback system improves perceived responsiveness and helps with error recovery.

features: Persistent toasts for errors (require manual dismiss)
Action button support: toast('Sync failed', 'error', {action: {text: 'Retry', onClick: syncFn}})

recommendations.title: Master's Application Pipeline Tracker
recommendations.description: Dedicated view for tracking grad school applications (Waterloo, Ottawa, Guelph) with deadlines, requirements checklist, and status progression.
recommendations.rationale: TJ's #1 priority is permanent residency, with Master's applications as a key path. The heartbeat nags about these deadlines weekly. A dedicated tracker reduces cognitive load.

ui_components: Requirement checklists with document upload placeholders

recommendations.title: Immigration Document Tracker
recommendations.description: Specialized tracker for PR application documents with expiry alerts, submission status, and checklist for the 'Bridge to Home' phase.
recommendations.rationale: Permanent residency is TJ's absolute #1 priority. Immigration stress is noted as a real anxiety trigger. Having clear visibility reduces uncertainty.

features: Document checklist with categories (identity, financial, employment, etc.)
Expiry date tracking for work permit, health card, etc.
Days until PR goal countdown (already exists, enhance it)
alerts: Warning if document expires in < 30 days

recommendations.title: Job Application Pipeline (Enhanced)
recommendations.description: Expand existing job tracking with interview stages, contact management, salary notes, and follow-up reminders.
recommendations.rationale: Full-time job is one of three parallel paths to PR (along with grad school). TJ has applied to Hamilton Library - this helps track all applications systematically.

implementation.enhance_existing: Notion jobs integration in Command tab
new_fields: Application stage: Applied → Phone Screen → Interview → Offer → Accepted/Rejected
visualizations: Pipeline view (like kanban but for job stages)

recommendations.impact: High - Supports employment path to PR

recommendations.title: Energy & Mood Tracker
recommendations.description: Simple 1-5 energy and mood logging with optional notes. Shows weekly patterns to help TJ understand his productive rhythms.
recommendations.rationale: TJ is a night owl but also deals with isolation/loneliness. Tracking patterns helps optimize when to schedule deep work vs. social time.

implementation.input_method: Click 1-5 stars for energy, 1-5 for mood
implementation.reminder: Optional daily prompt at configured time

recommendations.title: Walking Protocol Streak Tracker
recommendations.description: Track daily walks with streak counter and weekly goals. Visual representation of the 'physical engine must keep moving' heartbeat directive.
recommendations.rationale: Heartbeat explicitly mentions 'Verify Walking Protocol maintenance — physical engine must keep moving'. This makes it visible and gamified.

implementation.integration: Link to Notes tab for walking observations

recommendations.title: Weekly Review Mode
recommendations.description: Special view that aggregates: tasks completed, meetings held, applications progressed, energy trends, and highlights for the week. Generates a summary.
recommendations.rationale: TJ rejects task managers in favor of calendar-only. A weekly review gives the reflection benefits without daily task management overhead.

implementation.output: Markdown summary that can be copied to Notes or exported

recommendations.impact: Low - Nice to have for reflection

recommendations.title: Virtual Scrolling for Long Lists
recommendations.description: Implement virtual scrolling for activity feed, task lists, and intel cards when they exceed 50 items. Only render visible items.
recommendations.rationale: Current implementation renders all items. As TJ uses Pleiades over months, lists will grow and cause slowdowns.

implementation.technique: CSS-based virtual scroll with fixed item heights
implementation.buffer: Render 5 items above and below viewport

recommendations.title: localStorage Data Compression
recommendations.description: Compress data before storing to localStorage using LZ-string or similar. Current storage can hit the ~5MB limit.
recommendations.rationale: The audit noted 'Storage used' logging. With intensive use (notes, logs, intel), TJ may hit browser limits.

implementation.migration: Auto-detect uncompressed data and migrate on first read

recommendations.title: Tab Content Lazy Loading
recommendations.description: Only render tab content when first visited, keep rendered tabs in memory. Currently all tabs render on load (implied by structure).
recommendations.rationale: Faster initial load, especially on mobile. The PWA works on phones - this improves the mobile experience.

implementation.in_renderActiveTab: Mark tab as rendered; Don't re-render if already rendered unless data changes
implementation.cleanup: Optional: Unrender tabs not visited in last N days to save memory

recommendations.title: Complete Data Export/Backup System
recommendations.description: One-click export of ALL Pleiades data as JSON. Include automatic daily backups to Downloads folder (via download attribute).
recommendations.rationale: The audit noted 'No Data Export/Backup' as a concern. TJ's data represents significant life tracking - losing it would be devastating.

implementation.auto_backup: Optional: Trigger download on first load of each day if enabled

recommendations.title: Data Import & Migration Tool
recommendations.description: Import previously exported data. Merge or replace existing data. Validate schema version.
recommendations.rationale: Pair to export - enables switching devices, recovering from data loss, or starting fresh while keeping history.

implementation.validation: Check schema version, show preview of what will be imported
implementation.safety: Auto-export current state before import (rollback capability)

recommendations.title: Enhanced Notion Sync Status
recommendations.description: Show per-database sync status, last sync time per database, conflict resolution UI, and offline queue for changes made while disconnected.
recommendations.rationale: Current sync is all-or-nothing. TJ uses Notion for serious work - better sync visibility increases trust in the integration.

implementation.offline_queue: Store changes made while 'Local', sync when connection restored
implementation.conflict_ui: Side-by-side diff when Notion and local both changed

recommendations.title: Calendar Integration (iCal/ICS Export)
recommendations.description: Export meetings and deadlines as .ics file for import into Google Calendar, Apple Calendar, etc.
recommendations.rationale: TJ uses calendar-only for time management. This bridges Pleiades with his existing workflow.

implementation.subscription: Optional: Generate data URI that can be 'subscribed' to for updates

creative_surprises.title: The Curator Alert
creative_surprises.concept: When TJ hasn't created anything (tasks, notes, decisions) for 3+ days, show a subtle but increasing visual reminder of the Paintress Truth: 'The Curator approaches. Create to hold her at bay.'
creative_surprises.implementation: Track lastActivity timestamp. If now - lastActivity > 3 days, add CSS animation to logo (subtle pulsing red glow). After 7 days, show modal on load with quote and quick-actions to create something.
creative_surprises.why: Turns the Paintress mythos into a gentle accountability mechanism.

creative_surprises.title: Constellation Visualization
creative_surprises.concept: Visualize TJ's network (Serena, Flora, Alex) as actual stars in the background. Serena = bright north star (grounding), Flora = warm nearby star (anchor), Alex = dim red dwarf (restricted).
creative_surprises.implementation: Add SVG constellation overlay to starfield. Serena pulses gently (stability), Flora glows warm (presence), Alex flickers occasionally but stays distant. Hover shows name and role.
creative_surprises.why: Makes the support network from USER.md visible and present in the interface.

creative_surprises.title: 90-Day Win Progress Ring
creative_surprises.concept: A circular progress indicator showing progress toward the 90-day win: 'Progress on: full-time job OR grad school OR permanent residency.'
creative_surprises.implementation: Add to dashboard metrics. Calculate based on: job applications sent, grad school apps submitted, PR documents filed. Each major milestone = 33%. Fill ring as progress is made.
creative_surprises.why: Visual representation of the most important goal from USER.md.
